title: and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No 298 of 2002) (as adapted by the
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Road Traffic (Recognition of Foreign
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Road Traffic (Recognition of Foreign 

Driving Licences) (United Kingdom) Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited road traffic (recognition foreign driving licences) (united kingdom) order 2020

title: and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No 298 of 2002) (as adapted by the
heading: 2. This Order shall come into operation on 31 December 2020 at 11 p.m.
text_raw: 2. This Order shall come into operation on 31 December 2020 at 11 p.m.
text_norm: 2 order shall come operation 31 december 2020 11 p.m

title: and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No 298 of 2002) (as adapted by the
heading: In this Order “2006 Regulations” means the Road Traffic (Licensing of
text_raw:
3. 

In this Order “2006 Regulations” means the Road Traffic (Licensing of 

Drivers) Regulations 2006 (S.I. 537 of 2006).
text_norm: 3 order 2006 regulation mean road traffic (licensing drivers) regulation 2006 (s.i 537 2006)

title: and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No 298 of 2002) (as adapted by the
heading: It is declared that a licence or permit permitting a person to drive a
text_raw:
4. 

It is declared that a licence or permit permitting a person to drive a 
mechanically propelled vehicle, not being a licence or permit issued to a person 
to enable that person to learn or provisionally to drive such a vehicle, issued by 
a competent authority of the United Kingdom in a category which corresponds 
to a category specified in the Table to Regulation 6 of the 2006 Regulations 
shall be recognised for the purpose of exchange of that licence or permit for a 
driving licence.
text_norm: 4 declared licence permit permitting person drive mechanically propelled vehicle licence permit issued person enable person learn provisionally drive vehicle issued competent authority united kingdom category corresponds category specified table regulation 6 2006 regulation shall recognised purpose exchange licence permit driving licence

title: and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No 298 of 2002) (as adapted by the
heading: 5. A licence or permit –
text_raw:
5. A licence or permit – 

(a) 

issued by a competent authority of the United Kingdom in a 
category which corresponds to a category set out in column (1) 
of the Table to Regulation 27(3)(a) of the 2006 Regulations, also 
referred to in the Table to Regulation 6 of 2006 Regulations, and 

(b) which includes a category set out in column (2) of the Table to 
Regulation 27(3)(a) of the 2006 Regulations opposite the 
mention in column (1) of the category referred to in paragraph 
(a) which was granted in exchange for a licence or permit issued 
by a state (other than the State) which is not a Member State or a 
state to which an order under section 23A of the Road Traffic 
Act 1961 applies, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 5th January, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [683] 3 

shall be recognised in respect of the category set out in column (2) for the 
purpose of exchange of that licence or permit under Article 4.
text_norm: 5 licence permit - (a) issued competent authority united kingdom category corresponds category set column (1) table regulation 27(3)(a) 2006 regulation also referred table regulation 6 2006 regulation (b) includes category set column (2) table regulation 27(3)(a) 2006 regulation opposite mention column (1) category referred paragraph (a) granted exchange licence permit issued state (other state) member state state order section 23a road traffic act 1961 applies notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 5th january 2021 683 3 shall recognised respect category set column (2) purpose exchange licence permit article 4

title: and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No 298 of 2002) (as adapted by the
heading: 6. This Order shall not apply to a category on a licence or permit issued by
text_raw:
6. This Order shall not apply to a category on a licence or permit issued by 
a competent authority of the United Kingdom in exchange for a licence or 
permit issued by a state (other than the State) which is not a Member State or a 
state to which an order under section 23A of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 
of 1961) applies, other than in respect of a category set out in column (2) 
referred to in Article 5(b). 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

22 December, 2020. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [683]

title: and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No 298 of 2002) (as adapted by the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order gives effect to an Agreement between Ireland and the United 
Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland on the mutual exchange of 
driving licences. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [683] 5
